Module 4.2

Regression Tables and Coefficient Plots

Prework
  • Install peacesciencer and familiarize yourself with the documentation, install.packages("peacesciencer")

Use {peacesciencer}, teach broom, regression table package of some sort and coeffplots.

library(peacesciencer)
{peacesciencer} includes additional remote data for separate download. Please type ?download_extdata() for more information.
This message disappears on load when these data are downloaded and in the package's `extdata` directory.
library(dplyr)
Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.2.3

Attaching package: 'dplyr'
The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
conflict_df <- create_stateyears(system = 'gw') |>
  filter(year %in% c(1949:2019)) |>
  add_ucdp_acd(type=c("intrastate"), only_wars = FALSE) |>
  add_democracy() |>
  add_creg_fractionalization() |>
  add_sdp_gdp() |>
  add_rugged_terrain()
Joining with `by = join_by(gwcode, year)`
Joining with `by = join_by(gwcode, year)`
Joining with `by = join_by(gwcode, year)`
Joining with `by = join_by(gwcode, year)`
Joining with `by = join_by(gwcode)`

library(broom)

conflict_model <- glm(ucdponset ~ ethpol + relpol + polity2 + newlmtnest +
                        wbgdppc2011est + wbpopest,
                  data=subset(conflict_df),
                  family = binomial(link="logit"))

#tidy(conflict_model)

conflict_model |>
  tidy() |>
  mutate_if(is.numeric, round, 5)

When a coefficient plot is better

A table is not as compelling for one model.

modelsummary(conflict_model, 
             stars = TRUE,  
             gof_map = c("nobs"),
             coef_map = coef_map,
             title = caption, 
             notes = reference)
Table 1: Predictors of Conflict Onset
 (1)
Per capita GDP ‚àí0.549***
(0.098)
Population 0.312***
(0.066)
Intercept ‚àí4.954***
(1.327)
Num.Obs. 8049
+ p < 0.1, * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001
See appendix for data sources.

Better to do a coefficient plot. Have to call ggplot2 for customization.
